contextId.information: Paul compares suffering  for Christ Jesus to the suffering that a good soldier endures. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: as a good soldier of Christ Jesus

contextId.information: "like a workman" or "like a worker." Paul presents the idea of Timothy correctly explaining God's word as if he were a skilled workman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

Just as gangrene quickly spreads in a person's body and destroys it, what those people were saying would spread from person to person and harm the faith of those who heard it. AT: "What they say will spread like an infectious disease" or "Their talk will spread quickly and cause destruction like gangrene"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Their talk will spread like gangrene
